content:
────────────────────────────────
**Summary**
• Neuralink, Elon Musk’s brain implant venture, tried to trademark “Telepathy” and “Telekinesis” for its products.
• Problem is, someone else already filed for those trademarks, throwing a wrench in Neuralink’s plans.
• The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) denied Neuralink’s applications, leaving the company to regroup or appeal.

Impact — Neuralink’s branding dreams are stalled, and they’ll have to fight harder to own these iconic sci-fi terms.

────────────────────────────────
Link: https://www.wired.com/story/uspto-denies-neuralinks-applications-for-telepathy-telekinesis-marks/
